title: Robert Glen Sirl found guilty after plying teenage girl with drugs and raping woman
text:
A man plied a teenage girl with drugs for sex before raping another woman so badly she lost more than a litre of blood.

Robert Glen Sirl faced two trials over the separate incidents at Australian Capital Territory Supreme Court earlier this year.

In the first trial the court heard a woman had visited Sirl at a caravan park to buy cannabis and the pair ended up drinking coffee mixed with the drug ice in August 2018, Canberra Times reported.

Robert Glen Sirl faced two trials over the separate incidents at Australian Capital Territory Supreme Court earlier this year

Sirl then said he was missing tens of thousands of dollars in cash and stopped the woman from leaving.

He raped the woman leaving her with severe bleeding from internal lacerations to her vaginal wall.

A doctor examined the woman who said there were as many as five incised wounds that indicated a knife had been used.

Though the object that caused the injuries has not been identified.

Sirl claimed the woman had consented and pleaded not guilty.

During the second trial the court heard Sirl would smoke weed and ice with a 15-year-old girl.

The teenager told her carer she had sexual intercourse with the man and that a condom was not used.

Sirl claimed he did not know the girl was under the age of 16, but the jury dismissed his defence.

He was found guilty of maintaining a sexual relationship with a young person and is up for sentencing.
